author: Adrian Rauso
title: Union wants BHP to pay extra super, $7.5k ‘mentor’ bonus, plus $10k ‘retention’ bonus and big salary bump
text: exclusive Union wants BHP to pay extra super, $7.5k ‘mentor’ bonus, plus $10k ‘retention’ bonus and big salary bump The full list of demands imposed on BHP by the Australian Workers Union can be revealed, with excess superannuation and fortnightly ‘mentoring bonuses’ being piled onto yearly $10,000 ‘retention bonuses’ and wage hikes. The AWU is targeting BHP’s massive Mining Area C and South Flank iron ore mining operations in an endeavour to reconquer the mining heartland of WA, buoyed by Federal Labor’s overhaul of industrial relations laws.
